channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13897] OOM may occur when Import imports a row with too many KeyValues
item.description: When importing a row with too many KeyValues (may have too many columns or versions)，KeyValueReducer will incur OOM.
item.summary: OOM may occur when Import imports a row with too many KeyValues

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Add a parameter of import.bulk.isLargeResult to suppor a row contains too much KeyValues.
Use MR sort instead of KeyValueSortReducer and add some inner classes.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12739437/HBASE-13897-0.98.patch
against 0.98 branch at commit 293506c7cdef3e866c75a7b92558a423eb804d11.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12739437

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop versions. The patch compiles with all supported hadoop versions (2.4.1 2.5.2 2.6.0)

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 protoc. The applied patch does not increase the total number of protoc compiler warnings.

-1 javadoc. The javadoc tool appears to have generated 25 warning messages.

-1 checkstyle. The applied patch generated 3904 checkstyle errors (more than the master's current 3893 errors).

-1 InterfaceAudience. The patch appears to contain InterfaceAudience from hadoop rather than hbase:
+import org.apache.hadoop.classification.InterfaceAudience;
+import org.apache.hadoop.classification.InterfaceStability;.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces the following lines longer than 100:
+ public static class KeyValueWritableComparablePartitioner extends Partitioner<KeyValueWritableComparable, KeyValue> {
+ public static class KeyValueWritableComparable implements WritableComparable<KeyValueWritableComparable> {
+ public static class KeyValueReducer extends Reducer<KeyValueWritableComparable, KeyValue, ImmutableBytesWritable, KeyValue> {
+ org.apache.hadoop.mapreduce.Reducer<KeyValueWritableComparable, KeyValue, ImmutableBytesWritable, KeyValue>.Context context)
+ public static class KeyValueSortImporter extends TableMapper<KeyValueWritableComparable, KeyValue> {
+ HTable table = new HTable(context.getConfiguration(), context.getConfiguration().get(TABLE_NAME));
+ KeyValueWritableComparable[] startKeyWraps = new KeyValueWritableComparable[startKeys.length - 1];
+ startKeyWraps[i - 1] = new KeyValueWritableComparable(KeyValue.createFirstOnRow(startKeys[i]));

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.TestImportExport

-1 core zombie tests. There are 2 zombie test(s): at org.apache.camel.component.jetty.jettyproducer.HttpJettyProducerRecipientListCustomThreadPoolTest.testRecipientList(HttpJettyProducerRecipientListCustomThreadPoolTest.java:40)
at org.apache.camel.component.jms.issues.JmsResequencerTest.testResequencer(JmsResequencerTest.java:54)
at org.apache.camel.component.jms.issues.JmsResequencerTest.testBatchResequencer(JmsResequencerTest.java:37)

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14397//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14397//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html
Checkstyle Errors: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14397//artifact/patchprocess/checkstyle-aggregate.html

Javadoc warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14397//artifact/patchprocess/patchJavadocWarnings.txt
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14397//console

This message is automatically generated.

-1 InterfaceAudience. The patch appears to contain InterfaceAudience from hadoop rather than hbase:

Please use the following:


import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.classification.InterfaceAudience;

import org.apache.hadoop.hbase.classification.InterfaceStability;

Wrap long line:


+  public static class KeyValueWritableComparablePartitioner extends Partitioner<KeyValueWritableComparable, KeyValue> {



+    public int compareTo(KeyValueWritableComparable o) {

+     return KeyValue.COMPARATOR.compare(this.kv, ((KeyValueWritableComparable)o).kv);

+    }

Should we check o against null before casting ?


+        } catch (IOException e) {

+         e.printStackTrace();

Please drop 'e.printStackTrace()'


-        if (CellUtil.isDeleteFamily(kv)) {

-          Delete deleteFamily = new Delete(key.get());

Where is the above case handled ?
Please check failure in TestImportExport
Please attach patch for master branch.
Thank you for your attention.Sorry for I am quite busy this week.I will finish it before long.
I believe I've discussed this with others (Lars Hofhansl?) in the past – better to always use MR sort and be rid of these sorting reducers all together.
Is this for the case where Import generates HFiles? In that case I do not see how we can avoid the the reduce step - unless we write an HFile per map task.

It is for the case where Import generates HFiles, but only avoid the oom in the reduce step and the reduce just do context.write.
If we skip the reduce step, we will do more split hfile in completebulkload.
Any chance of an update, Junhong ?
I'll try to merge it to master branch this weekend.
Attach the patch for master branch.

HI, I attach the patch for master branch.This patch runs ok in 0.98.6. But i have no cluster that version is 2.0.0-SNAPSHOT.Can you test the patch, please?Or, is there anything that i can do? Thank you.

+ Reducer<KeyValueWritableComparable, KeyValue, ImmutableBytesWritable, KeyValue>.Context context)
+ public static class KeyValueSortImporter extends TableMapper<KeyValueWritableComparable, KeyValue> {
+ KeyValueWritableComparable[] startKeyWraps = new KeyValueWritableComparable[startKeys.length - 1];

+ Path partitionsPath = new Path(TotalOrderPartitioner.getPartitionFile(job.getConfiguration()));

+1 site. The mvn post-site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14594//testReport/
Release Findbugs (version 2.0.3) warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/14594//artifact/patchprocess/newFindbugsWarnings.html

This message is automatically generated.
You can use dev-support/checkstyle_report.py to find checkstyle warnings and correct them.

179	          context.setStatus("Wrote " + index);

Add more to the above log. e.g. "Wrote " + index + " KeyValues"


232	          throw new IOException("Region splitted after job initialization");

The past tense of split is split.


674	    System.err.println("If there is no large results that including too much KeyValue "

675	        + "whitch can use the memery sort in reducer, pass the option:");

Syntax error. Should be:


674	    System.err.println("If there is no large result that includes too many KeyValues "

675	        + "which can use the memory sort in reducer, pass the option:");



676	    System.err.println("  -D" + HAS_LARGE_RESULT + "=false");

Should the option be turned off by default ?

Modified according to the Ted's recommendation.
Thank you!

So, is there anthing that i should to do?
Thanks Junhong for the fix.
